ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Messages] Unless otherwise specified, buffers and fields in this section are depicted in little-endian byte order.
[In Transport] The ROP input/output buffer, as specified in section 2.2.1, is sent as part of either the payload of the EcDoRpcExt2 RPC method, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.2.
[In Transport] The ROP input/output buffer, as specified in section 2.2.1, is sent as part of the payload of or the Execute request type, <1> as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 2.2.4.2.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] The ROP input buffer, which is sent by the client, includes an array of ROP request buffers to be processed by the server.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] The ROP output buffer, which is sent by the server, includes an array of ROP response buffers.

[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] The ROP input and output buffers are transmitted between the client and the server as part of the payload of either the EcDoRpcExt2 method, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.2.

[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] The ROP input and output buffers are transmitted between the client and the server as part of the payload of or the Execute request type, <2> as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 2.2.4.2.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] The ROP input buffer and ROP output buffer have the following structure[RopSize (2 bytes), RopsList (variable) and ServerObjectHandleTable (variable)].
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopSize (2 bytes): This value specifies the size of both this field[RopSize] and the RopsList field.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopsList (variable): An array of ROP buffers.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopsList (variable): For a ROP input buffer, this field contains an array of ROP request buffers.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopsList (variable): For a ROP output buffer, this field contains an array of ROP response buffers.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopsList (variable): The format of each ROP buffer is specified in subsequent sections.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] RopsList (variable): The size of this field is 2 bytes less than the value specified in the RopSize field.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] ServerObjectHandleTable (variable): An array of 32-bit values.
[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] ServerObjectHandleTable (variable):Each 32-bit value specifies a Server object handle that is referenced by a ROP buffer.

[In ROP Input and Output Buffers] ServerObjectHandleTable (variable):The size of this field is equal to the number of bytes of data remaining in the ROP Input and Output Buffers after the RopsList field.
[In The Table of RopIds] Each ROP is identified by a one-byte value, which is contained in the RopId field of ROP request buffers and ROP response buffers.
[In The Table of RopIds] The ROPs that a client is allowed to use are listed in the following table[the table in section 2.2.2].
[In The Table of RopIds] A RopId value that is specified as "Reserved" is not used in the communication between the client and server.

[In The Table of RopIds] The following RopId values represent the Reserved ROP Ids: 0x00, 0x28, 0x3C, 0x3D,0x52, 0x62, 0x65, 0x6A, 0x71, 0x7C, 0x7D, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x87, 0x88, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x98, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9B, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0xA0, 0xA1, 0xA2, 0xA3, 0xA4, 0xA5, 0xA6, 0xA7, 0xA8, 0xA9, 0xAA, 0xAB, 0xAC, 0xAD, 0xAE, 0xAF, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD1, 0xD2, 0xD3, 0xD4, 0xD5, 0xD6, 0xD7, 0xD8, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDD, 0xDE, 0xDF, 0xE0, 0xE1, 0xE2, 0xE3, 0xE4, 0xE5, 0xE6, 0xE7, 0xE8, 0xE9, 0xEA, 0xEB, 0xEC, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF0, 0xF1, 0xF2, 0xF3, 0xF4, 0xF5, 0xF6, 0xF7, 0xF8, 0xFA,0xFB, 0xFC and 0xFD.
[In The Table of RopIds] Therefore, the client MUST NOT use the reserved RopId values.
[In The Table of RopIds] When the server encounters a RopId value that is associated with a reserved ROP, it SHOULD<3> return an error for the RPC, as specified in [MS-OXCRPC] section 3.1.4.2.

[In The Table of RopIds] When the server encounters a RopId value that is associated with a reserved ROP, it SHOULD<3> return an error for the Execute request type<4> response, as specified in [MS-OXCMAPIHTTP] section 2.2.4.2.2.
[In RopLogon ROP] The RopLogon ROP logs on to a mailbox or public folder.
[In RopLogon ROP] For more details about this operation [RopLogon] , see [MS-OXCSTOR] section 2.2.1.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP request buffer.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopLogon], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0xFE.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): This value specifies the ID that the client wants associated with the created logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): Any value is allowed.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): The client does not have to use values in a certain numeric order.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): If the client specifies an active LogonID, the current logon is released.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): If the client specifies an active logon ID, the current logon is replaced with the new one.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): A flags structure .

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): The possible values[the value of Private is 0x01, the value of Undercover is 0x02 and the value of Ghosted is 0x04] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] Section 2.2.1.1.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): [This structure] contains flags that control the behavior of the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags (4 bytes): ): A flags structure .

[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags (4 bytes): The possible values[the value of USE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE is 0x00000001, the value of HOME_LOGON is 0x00000004, the value of TAKE_OWNERSHIP is 0x00000008, the value of ALTERNATE_SERVER is 0x00000100, the value of IGNORE_HOME_MDB is 0x00000200, the value of NO_MAIL is 0x00000400, the value of USE_PER_MDB_REPLID_MAPPING is 0x01000000 and the value of SUPPORT_PROGRESS is 0x20000000] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] Section 2.2.1.1.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] OpenFlags (4 bytes): [This structure] contains more flags that control the behavior of the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] StoreState (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] StoreState (4 bytes): This field is not used.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] StoreState (4 bytes): [This field is not used] and is ignored by the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXCROPS_R4678.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] StoreState (4 bytes): Reply is the same no matter what values are used for this field.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] StoreState (4 bytes):This field MUST be set to 0x00000000.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] EssdnSize (2 bytes):An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] EssdnSize (2 bytes): This value specifies the size of the Essdn field.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn (variable): A null-terminated ASCII string.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn (variable): The number of characters (including the terminating null character) contained in this field is specified by the EssdnSize field.
[In RopLogon ROP Request Buffer] Essdn (variable): This string specifies which mailbox to log on to.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP success response buffer for private mailboxes.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] RopId (1 byte): ): An unsigned integer .
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopLogon], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0xFE.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonFlags (1 byte): ): A flags structure.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonFlags (1 byte): The possible values[the value of Private is 0x01, the value of Undercover is 0x02 and the value of Ghosted is 0x04] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] Section2.2.1.1.3.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonFlags (1 byte): These flags specify the type of logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] FolderIds (104 bytes): 13 64-bit identifiers.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] FolderIds (104 bytes): These IDs specify a set of special folders for a mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ResponseFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ResponseFlags (1 byte): The possible values[the value of Reserved is 0x01, the value of OwnerRight is 0x02, the value of SendAsRight is 0x04, the value of OOF is 0x10] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] Section 2.2.1.1.3.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ResponseFlags (1 byte): These flags provide details about the state of the mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] MailboxGuid (16 bytes): A GUID.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] MailboxGuid (16 bytes): This value identifies the mailbox on which the logon was performed.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReplId (2 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReplId (2 bytes): This field specifies a replica ID for the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReplGuid (16 bytes): ): A GUID.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] ReplGuid (16 bytes): This field specifies the replica GUID that is associated with the replica ID, which is specified in the ReplId field.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonTime (8 bytes): A LogonTime structure.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonTime (8 bytes): The format of this structure is specified in section 2.2.3.1.2.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] LogonTime (8 bytes): This structure specifies the time at which the logon occurred.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] GwartTime (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] GwartTime (8 bytes): This field contains a numeric value that tracks the currency of the Gateway Address Routing Table (GWART).
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] GwartTime (8 bytes): The server generates a new numeric value with each change of the GWART.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] GwartTime (8 bytes): The client can use the value of this field in a comparison to detect a change, but does not interpret the value of this field.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] StoreState (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] StoreState (4 bytes): This field MUST be set to 0x00000000 by the server.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Private Mailboxes] StoreState (4 bytes):This field MUST be ignored by the client.
[In LogonTime Structure] The following descriptions define valid fields for the LogonTime structure.
[In LogonTime Structure] Seconds (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Seconds (1 byte): This value specifies the current second.
[In LogonTime Structure] Minutes (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Minutes (1 byte): This value specifies the current minute.
[In LogonTime Structure] Hour (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Hour (1 byte): This value specifies the current hour.
[In LogonTime Structure] DayOfWeek (1 byte): An enumeration.
[In LogonTime Structure] DayOfWeek (1 byte): This value specifies the current day of the week (Sunday = 0, Monday = 1, and so on).
[In LogonTime Structure] Day (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Day (1 byte): This value specifies the current day of the month.
[In LogonTime Structure] Month (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Month (1 byte): This value specifies the current month (January = 1, February = 2, and so on).
[In LogonTime Structure] Year (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In LogonTime Structure] Year (2 bytes): This value specifies the current year.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP success response buffer for public folders.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopLogon], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0xFE.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Success Response Buffer for Public Folders], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags (1 byte): The possible values[the value of Public is 0x00] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR]2.2.1.1.4.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] LogonFlags (1 byte): These flags specify the type of logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] FolderIds (104 bytes): 13 64-bit identifiers.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] FolderIds (104 bytes): These IDs specify a set of special folders for a mailbox.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplId (2 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplId (2 bytes): This field specifies a replica ID for the logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] ReplGuid (16 bytes): A GUID that specifies the replica GUID associated with the replica ID that is specified in the ReplId field.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] PerUserGuid (16 bytes): This field is not used and is ignored by the client.
[In RopLogon ROP Success Response Buffer for Public Folders] PerUserGuid (16 bytes): The server SHOULD set this field to all zeroes.<5>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R4720, MS-OXCROPS_R214.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP redirect response buffer.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopLogon], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0xFE.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Redirect Response], this field is set to 0x00000478.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.

[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): The possible values[the value of Private is 0x01, the value of Undercover is 0x02, the value of Ghosted is 0x04] are specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] Section 2.2.1.1.2.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] LogonFlags (1 byte): These flags specify the type of logon.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerNameSize (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerNameSize (1 byte): This value specifies the length of the ServerName field.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName (variable): A null-terminated ASCII string.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName (variable): The number of characters (including the terminating null character) contained in this field is specified by the ServerNameSize field.
[In RopLogon ROP Redirect Response Buffer] ServerName (variable): This string specifies a different server for the client to connect to.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLogon ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopLogon], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0xFE.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopLogon ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Failure Response], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000 or 0x00000478.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] The RopGetReceiveFolder ROP gets the Receive folder for incoming messages of a particular message class.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP] For more details about this operation [RopGetReceiveFolder], see [MS-OXCSTOR] section 2.2.1.2.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP request buffer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopGetReceiveFolder], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x27.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): This value[LogonId (1 byte)] specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopGetReceiveFolder].
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass (variable): A null-terminated ASCII string.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass (variable): This string specifies which message class to find the receive folder for.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP success response buffer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopGetReceiveFolder], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x27.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer index.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): This value specifies the Receive folder.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass (variable): A null-terminated ASCII string.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Success Response Buffer] ExplicitMessageClass (variable): This string specifies the message class that is actually configured for delivery to the folder.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetReceiveFolder ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer .
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopGetReceiveFolder], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x27.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): ): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopGetReceiveFolder ROP Failure Response Buffer] ReturnValue (4 bytes): For this response[Failure Response], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] The RopSetReceiveFolder ROP sets the Receive folder for incoming messages of a particular message class.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP] For more details about this operation, see [MS-OXCSTOR] section 2.2.1.3.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetReceiveFolder ROP request buffer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopSetReceiveFolder], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x26.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): This value[LogonId (1 byte)] specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopSetReceiveFolder].
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): This index[InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] FolderId (8 bytes): This value specifies the Receive folder.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass (variable): A null-terminated ASCII string.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Request Buffer] MessageClass (variable): This string specifies which message class to set the Receive folder for.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetReceiveFolder ROP response buffer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): For this operation[RopSetReceiveFolder], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x26.
[In RopSetReceiveFolder ROP Response Buffer] InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.

[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)] For this operation[RopReadRecipients], this field[RopId (1 byte)] is set to 0x0F.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopReadRecipients].
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer]RowId (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,RowId (4 bytes)]This value specifies the starting index for the recipients (2) to be retrieved.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer]Reserved (2 bytes): Reserved.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,Reserved (2 bytes)]This field MUST be set to 0x0000.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Request Buffer,Reserved (2 bytes)]Server behavior is undefined if this field[Reserved (2 bytes)] is not set to 0x0000.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReadRecipients ROP success response buffer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReadRecipients], this field is set to 0x0F.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer]RowCount (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,RowCount (1 byte)]This value specifies the number of structures in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientRows (variable): A list of ReadRecipientRow structures.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The number of structures contained in this field is specified by the RowCount field.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The format of the ReadRecipientRow structure is defined in section 2.2.6.6.2.1.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure] The following descriptions define valid fields for the ReadRecipientRow structure.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]RowId (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RowId (4 bytes)]This value specifies the ID of the recipient.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]RecipientType (1 byte): An enumeration.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RecipientType (1 byte)]The possible values[0x01, 0x02 and 0x03] for this enumeration are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.1.2.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RecipientType (1 byte)]This enumeration specifies the type of recipient (2).
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]CodePageId (2 bytes): An identifier.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,CodePageId (2 bytes)] This value specifies the code page for the recipient (2).
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]Reserved (2 bytes): Reserved.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,Reserved (2 bytes)]The server MUST set this field to 0x0000.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]RecipientRowSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RecipientRowSize (2 bytes)]This value specifies the size of the RecipientRow field.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure]RecipientRow (variable): A RecipientRow structure.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RecipientRow (variable)]The format of this structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.8.3.
[In ReadRecipientRow structure,RecipientRow (variable)]The size of this field, in bytes, is specified by the RecipientRowSize field.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReadRecipients ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReadRecipients], this field is set to 0x0F.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopReadRecipients ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)] For this response, this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] The RopReloadCachedInformation ROP gets message and recipient (2) information from a message.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP] For more details about this operation[RopReloadCachedInformation], see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.7.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReloadCachedInformation ROP request buffer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReloadCachedInformation], this field is set to 0x10.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopReloadCachedInformation].
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer]Reserved (2 bytes): Reserved.
[In Request Buffer,Reserved (2 bytes)]This field MUST be set to 0x0000.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Request Buffer,Reserved (2 bytes)]Server behavior is undefined if this field is not set to 0x0000.
The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReloadCachedInformation ROP success response buffer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReloadCachedInformation], this field is set to 0x10.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex specified field in the request.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response ], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]HasNamedProperties (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,HasNamedProperties (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the message has named properties.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]SubjectPrefix (variable): A TypedString structure.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,SubjectPrefix (variable)]The format of the TypedString structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.7.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,SubjectPrefix (variable)]This value specifies the subject prefix of the message.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]NormalizedSubject (variable): A TypedString structure.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,NormalizedSubject (variable)]This value specifies the normalized subject of the message.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientCount (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of recipients on the message.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]ColumnCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,ColumnCount (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of structures in the RecipientColumns field.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientColumns (variable): An array of PropertyTag structures.

[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]The number of structures contained in this field[RecipientColumns (variable)] is specified by the ColumnCount field.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]The format of the PropertyTag structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.9.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]This field specifies the property values that can be included for each recipient (2).
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]RowCount (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RowCount (1 byte)]This value specifies the number of rows in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientRows (variable): A list of OpenRecipientRow structures.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The number of structures contained in this field[RecipientRows (variable)] is specified by the RowCount field.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The format of the OpenRecipientRow structure is defined in section 2.2.6.1.2.1.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReloadCachedInformation ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReloadCachedInformation], this field is set to 0x10.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopReloadCachedInformation ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Failure Response], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] The RopSetMessageStatus ROP sets the status of a message in a folder.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP] For more details about this operation[RopSetMessageStatus], see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.8.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetMessageStatus ROP request buffer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetMessageStatus], this field is set to 0x20.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopSetMessageStatus].
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageId (8 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,MessageId (8 bytes)]This value identifies the message for which the status will be changed.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes)]This field contains status flags to set on the message.

[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes)]The possible values[the value of msRemoteDownload is 0x00001000, the value of msInConflict is 0x00000800 and the value of msRemoteDelete is 0x00002000] are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.8.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R542, MS-OXCMSG_R544, MS-OXCMSG_R545, MS-OXCMSG_R547.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageStatusMask (4 bytes): A bitmask.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,MessageStatusMask (4 bytes)]This bitmask specifies which bits in the MessageStatusFlags field are to be changed.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetMessageStatus ROP success response buffer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetMessageStatus], this field is set to 0x20.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer]MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes)]This field contains the status flags that were set on the message before this operation[RopSetMessageStatus].

[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Success Response Buffer,MessageStatusFlags (4 bytes)]The possible values[zero, the value of msRemoteDownload is 0x00001000, the value of msInConflict is 0x00000800 and the value of msRemoteDelete is 0x00002000] are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.8.2.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetMessageStatus ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetMessageStatus], this field is set to 0x20.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSetMessageStatus ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Failure Response ], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] The RopGetMessageStatus ROP returns the status of a message in a folder.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP] For more details about this operation[RopGetMessageStatus], see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.9.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetMessageStatus ROP request buffer.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopGetMessageStatus], this field is set to 0x1F.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopGetMessageStatus].
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer]MessageId (8 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Request Buffer,MessageId (8 bytes)]This value identifies the message for which the status will be returned.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffers ] The response buffers for this ROP are the same as those for the RopSetMessageStatus ROP, as specified in sections 2.2.6.8.2 and 2.2.6.8.3.
[In RopGetMessageStatus ROP Response Buffers ] The value of the RopId field for RopGetMessageStatus responses MUST be 0x20, which is the same as that for the RopSetMessageStatus responses.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] The RopSetReadFlags ROP sets the read flag for messages in a folder.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP] For more details about this operation, see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.10.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetReadFlags ROP request buffer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetReadFlags], this field is set to 0x66.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopSetReadFlags].
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]WantAsynchronous (1 byte): A Boolean.

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,WantAsynchronous (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the operation is to be processed asynchronously with status reported via the RopProgress ROP (section 2.2.8.13).
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]ReadFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,ReadFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of rfDefault is 0x00, the value of rfSuppressReceipt is 0x01, the value of rfReserved is 0x0A, the value of rfClearReadFlag is 0x04, the value of rfGenerateReceiptOnly is 0x10, the value of rfClearNotifyRead is 0x20 and the value of rfClearNotifyUnread is 0x40] for these flags are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.10.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R815, MS-OXCMSG_R817, MS-OXCMSG_R818, MS-OXCMSG_R820, MS-OXCMSG_R822, MS-OXCMSG_R823, MS-OXCMSG_R825, MS-OXCMSG_R827, MS-OXCMSG_R829.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,ReadFlags (1 byte)]These flags specify the flags to set.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]MessageIdCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]MessageIdCount (2 bytes)This value specifies the number of identifiers in the MessageIds field.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer]MessageIds (variable): An array of 64-bit identifiers.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,MessageIds (variable)]The number of identifiers contained in this field[MessageIds (variable)] is specified by the MessageIdCount field.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Request Buffer,MessageIds (variable)]These IDs specify the messages that are to have their read flags changed.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetReadFlags ROP response buffer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetReadFlags], this field is set to 0x66.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer]PartialCompletion (1 byte): An Boolean.
[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,PartialCompletion (1 byte)]This value indicates whether the operation was only partially completed.

[In RopSetReadFlags ROP Response Buffer,PartialCompletion (1 byte)]The operation is partially completed if the server was unable to modify one or more of the Message objects that are specified in the MessageIds field of the request.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] The RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP sets or clears the message read flag.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP] For more details about this operation[RopSetMessageReadFlag], see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.11.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP request buffer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetMessageReadFlag], this field is set to 0x11.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopSetMessageReadFlag].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]ResponseHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,ResponseHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table that is referenced in the response.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,ResponseHandleIndex (1 byte)]More information about Server objects can be found in section 3.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]ReadFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.

[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,ReadFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of rfDefault is 0x00, the value of rfSuppressReceipt is 0x01, the value of rfReserved is 0x0A, the value of rfClearReadFlag is 0x04, the value of rfGenerateReceiptOnly is 0x10, the value of rfClearNotifyRead is 0x20 and the value of rfClearNotifyUnread is 0x40] for these flags are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.11.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R815, MS-OXCMSG_R817, MS-OXCMSG_R818, MS-OXCMSG_R820, MS-OXCMSG_R822, MS-OXCMSG_R823, MS-OXCMSG_R825, MS-OXCMSG_R827, MS-OXCMSG_R829.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer]ClientData (24 bytes): An array of bytes.

[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]This field is present when the logon associated with LogonId was created with the Private flag, as specified in [MS-OXCSTOR] section 2.2.1.1.1, unset.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Request Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]is not present otherwise[when the logon associated with LogonId was not created with the Private flag unset].
[In Request Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]This value specifies the information that is returned to the client in a successful response.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP success response buffer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetMessageReadFlag], this field is set to 0x11.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]ResponseHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ResponseHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the ResponseHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]ReadStatusChanged (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ReadStatusChanged (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the read status of a public folder's message has changed.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This field is present when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is nonzero.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]is not present otherwise[when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is zero].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This field MUST be set to the value of the LogonId field in the request.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer]ClientData (24 bytes):An array of bytes.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]This field is present when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is nonzero.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]is not present otherwise[when the value in the ReadStatusChanged field is zero].
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Success Response Buffer,ClientData (24 bytes)]This field MUST be set to the value of the ClientData field in the request.

[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSetMessageReadFlag ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Failure Response], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] The RopOpenAttachment ROP opens an attachment to a message.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP] For more details about this operation, see [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.12.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenAttachment ROP request buffer.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer, RopId (1 byte)] This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopOpenAttachment], this field is set to 0x22.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopOpenAttachment].
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]More information about Server objects can be found in section 3.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)] This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer]OpenAttachmentFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.
[In RopOpenAttachment ROP Request Buffer,OpenAttachmentFlags (1 byte)]This field contains flags for opening attachments.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCMSG_R917, MS-OXCMSG_R918, MS-OXCMSG_R919.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP request buffer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopOpenEmbeddedMessage], this field is set to 0x46.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,CodePageId (2 bytes)]This value specifies which code page is used for string values associated with the message.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer]OpenModeFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.

[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Request Buffer,OpenModeFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of ReadOnly is 0x00, the value of ReadWrite is 0x01 and the value of Create is 0x02] are specified in [MS-OXCMSG] section 2.2.3.16.1.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP success response buffer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopOpenEmbeddedMessage], this field is set to 0x46.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the OutputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response ], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]Reserved (1 byte): Reserved.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,Reserved (1 byte)]This field MUST be set to 0x00.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]MessageId (8 bytes): An identifier.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,MessageId (8 bytes)]This value specifies the ID of the Embedded Message object.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]HasNamedProperties (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,HasNamedProperties (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the message has named properties.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]SubjectPrefix (variable): A TypedString structure.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,SubjectPrefix (variable)]The format of the TypedString structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.7.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,SubjectPrefix (variable)]This structure specifies the subject prefix of the message.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]NormalizedSubject (variable): A TypedString structure.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,NormalizedSubject (variable)]This structure specifies the normalized subject of the message.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientCount (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of recipients on the message.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]ColumnCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,ColumnCount (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of structures in the RecipientColumns field.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientColumns (variable): An array of PropertyTag structures.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]The number of structures contained in this field is specified by the ColumnCount field.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]The format of the PropertyTag structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.9.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientColumns (variable)]This field specifies the property values that can be included for each recipient (2).
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]RowCount (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RowCount (1 byte)]This value specifies the number of rows in the RecipientRows field.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer]RecipientRows (variable): A list of OpenRecipientRow structures.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The number of structures contained in this field[RecipientRows (variable)] is specified by the RowCount field.
[In RopOpenEmbeddedMessage ROP Success Response Buffer,RecipientRows (variable)]The format of the OpenRecipientRow structure is defined in section 2.2.6.1.2.1.

[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.

[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,QueryFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of NoStrings is 0x01 and the value of NoIds is 0x02] are specified in[MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.9.1.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,QueryFlags (1 byte)]These flags control how this ROP behaves.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer]HasGuid (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,HasGuid (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the PropertyGuid field is present.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer]PropertyGuid (16 bytes): A GUID.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,PropertyGuid (16 bytes)]This field is present if HasGuid is nonzero.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,PropertyGuid (16 bytes)]is not present if the value of the HasGuid field is zero.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Request Buffer,PropertyGuid (16 bytes)]This value specifies the subset of named properties to be returned.

[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Success Response Buffer,IdCount (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of Ids and names in the PropertyIds and PropertyNames fields, respectively.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Success Response Buffer]PropertyIds (variable): An array of unsigned 16-bit integers.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Success Response Buffer, PropertyIds (variable)] Each integer in the array is the property ID associated with a property name.
[In RopQueryNamedProperties ROP Success Response Buffer, PropertyIds (variable)] The number of integers in the array is specified by the IdCount field.

[In RopCopyTo ROP]The RopCopyTo ROP copies properties from one server object to another.
[In RopCopyTo ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.11.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCopyTo ROP request buffer.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCopyTo], this field is set to 0x39.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopCopyTo].
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]SourceHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the source Server Object is stored.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]DestHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,DestHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the destination Server Object is stored.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]WantAsynchronous (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,WantAsynchronous (1 byte)]This value specifies whether the operation is to be executed asynchronously with status reported via RopProgress (section 2.2.8.13).
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]WantSubObjects (1 byte): A Boolean.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,WantSubObjects (1 byte)]This value specifies whether to copy subobjects.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer]CopyFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.
[In RopCopyTo ROP Request Buffer,CopyFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of Move is 0x01 and the value of NoOverwrite is 0x02] are specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.11.1.
