ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenStream ROP]The RopOpenStream ROP opens a property for streaming access.
[In RopOpenStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.14.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)] For this operation[RopOpenStream], this field is set to 0x2B.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopOpenStream].
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]PropertyTag (4 bytes): A PropertyTag structure.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,PropertyTag (4 bytes)]The format of the PropertyTag structure is specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.9.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,PropertyTag (4 bytes)]This structure specifies the property of the object to stream.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer]OpenModeFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,OpenModeFlags (1 byte)]These flags control how the stream is opened.

[In RopOpenStream ROP Request Buffer,OpenModeFlags (1 byte)]The possible values[the value of ReadOnly is 0x00, the value of ReadWrite is 0x01 and the value of Create is 0x02] are specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.14.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCPRPT_R267 MS-OXCPRPT_R269 MS-OXCPRPT_R271 MS-OXCPRPT_R272 MS-OXCPRPT_R274 MS-OXCPRPT_R27401 MS-OXCPRPT_R27402 MS-OXCPRPT_R275 MS-OXCPRPT_R27501 MS-OXCPRPT_R27502.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenStream ROP success response buffer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopOpenStream], this field is set to 0x2B.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the OutputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer]StreamSize (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Success Response Buffer,StreamSize (4 bytes)]This value indicates the size of the stream opened.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopOpenStream ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopOpenStream], this field is set to 0x2B.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the OutputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopOpenStream ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Failure Response ], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopReadStream ROP]The RopReadStream ROP reads bytes from a stream.
[In RopReadStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.15.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReadStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReadStream], this field is set to 0x2C.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopReadStream].
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]ByteCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,ByteCount (2 bytes)]The value of this field specifies the maximum number of bytes to read if the value[ByteCount (2 bytes)] is not equal to 0xBABE.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer]MaximumByteCount (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,MaximumByteCount (4 bytes)]This value specifies the maximum number of bytes to read if the value of the ByteCount field is equal to 0xBABE.<9>
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,MaximumByteCount (4 bytes)]The MaximumByteCount field is present when ByteCount is equal to 0xBABE.
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,MaximumByteCount (4 bytes)] is not present otherwise[when ByteCount is not equal to 0xBABE].
[In RopReadStream ROP Request Buffer,MaximumByteCount (4 bytes)]If the value of the MaximumByteCount field is greater than 0x80000000, then the RPC call SHOULD fail with error code 0x000004B6.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopReadStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopReadStream], this field is set to 0x2C.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]DataSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,DataSize (2 bytes)]This value specifies the size, in bytes, of the Data field.

[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,DataSize (2 bytes),The maximum size is specified in the request buffer by one of the following:]The ByteCount field, when the value of the ByteCount value is not equal to 0xBABE.

[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,DataSize (2 bytes),The maximum size is specified in the request buffer by one of the following:]The MaximumByteCount field, when the value of the ByteCount field is equal to 0xBABE.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer]Data (variable): An array of bytes.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,Data (variable)]These values are the bytes read from the stream.
[In RopReadStream ROP Response Buffer,Data (variable)]The size of this field, in bytes, is specified by the DataSize field.
[In RopWriteStream ROP]The RopWriteStream ROP writes bytes to a stream.
[In RopWriteStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.16.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopWriteStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopWriteStream], this field is set to 0x2D.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopWriteStream].
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]DataSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,DataSize (2 bytes)] This value specifies the size of the Data field.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer]Data (variable): An array of bytes.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,Data (variable)]The size of this field[Data (variable)], in bytes, is specified by the DataSize field.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Request Buffer,Data (variable)]These values specify the bytes to be written to the stream.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopWriteStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopWriteStream], this field is set to 0x2D.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer]WrittenSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteStream ROP Response Buffer,WrittenSize (2 bytes)]This value specifies the number of bytes actually written.
[In RopCommitStream ROP]The RopCommitStream ROP commits stream operations.
[In RopCommitStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.17.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCommitStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCommitStream], this field is set to 0x5D.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopCommitStream].
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCommitStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCommitStream], this field is set to 0x5D.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCommitStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP]The RopGetStreamSize ROP gets the size of a stream.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.18.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer] The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetStreamSize ROP request buffer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopGetStreamSize], this field is set to 0x5E.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopGetStreamSize].
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.

[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopGetStreamSize], this field is set to 0x5E.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Success Response], this field is set to 0x00000000.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer]StreamSize (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Success Response Buffer,StreamSize (4 bytes)]This value is the current size of the stream.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopGetStreamSize ROP failure response buffer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopGetStreamSize], this field is set to 0x5E.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopGetStreamSize ROP Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Failure Response], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000000.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP]The RopSetStreamSize ROP sets the size of a stream.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.19.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetStreamSize ROP request buffer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetStreamSize], this field is set to 0x2F.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopSetStreamSize].
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer]StreamSize (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,StreamSize (8 bytes)]This value specifies the size of the stream.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,StreamSize (8 bytes)] The server limits the maximum size of the stream to the value specified in a configuration file.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Request Buffer,StreamSize (8 bytes)] If no value is specified in a configuration file, then the maximum size is 2^31 bytes.<10>
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopSetStreamSize ROP response buffer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopSetStreamSize], this field is set to 0x2F.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSetStreamSize ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopSeekStream ROP]The RopSeekStream ROP seeks to a specific offset within a stream.

[In RopSeekStream ROP Success Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopSeekStream ROP Success Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.

[In RopCopyToStream ROP]The RopCopyToStream ROP copies a number of bytes from a source stream to a destination stream.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.21..
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCopyToStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)] For this operation [RopCopyToStream], this field is set to 0x3A.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopCopyToStream].
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]SourceHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the source Server Object is stored.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]DestHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,DestHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the destination Server Object is stored.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer]ByteCount (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Request Buffer,ByteCount (8 bytes)]This value specifies the number of bytes to be copied.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCopyToStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCopyToStream], this field is set to 0x3A.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]SourceHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the SourceHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[except Null Destination Failure Response ], this field is set to a value other than 0x00000503.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,ReadByteCount (8 bytes)]This value specifies the number of bytes read from the source object.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]ReadByteCount (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer]WrittenByteCount (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Response Buffer,WrittenByteCount (8 bytes)]This value specifies the number of bytes written to the destination object.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCopyToStream ROP null destination failure response buffer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer, RopId (1 byte)] This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCopyToStream], this field is set to 0x3A.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]SourceHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,SourceHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the SourceHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]For this response[Null Destination Failure Response], this field is set to 0x00000503.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]DestHandleIndex (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,DestHandleIndex (4 bytes)]This index MUST be set to the specified in the DestHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]ReadByteCount (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,ReadByteCount (8 bytes)] for this response,this field SHOULD be set to 0x0000000000000000.<11>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXCROPS_R3411, MS-OXCROPS_R4692.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer]WrittenByteCount (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCopyToStream ROP Null Destination Failure Response Buffer,WrittenByteCount (8 bytes)]for this response[of written to the destination object],this field SHOULD be set to 0x0000000000000000<12>.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopLockRegionStream ROP]The RopLockRegionStream ROP locks a specified range of bytes in a stream.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP]For more details about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.23.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLockRegionStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopLockRegionStream], this field is set to 0x5B.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopLockRegionStream].
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RegionOffset (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RegionOffset (8 bytes)]This value specifies the byte location in the stream where the region begins.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RegionSize (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RegionSize (8 bytes)]This value specifies the size of the region, in bytes.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]LockFlags (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LockFlags (4 bytes)]This structure contains flags specifying the behavior of the lock operation.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LockFlags (4 bytes)]The possible values[0x001 and Any other value] for this structure are specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.23.1.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopLockRegionStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopLockRegionStream], this field is set to 0x5B.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopLockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP]The RopUnlockRegionStream ROP unlocks a specified range of bytes in a stream.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP]For more details about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.24.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopUnlockRegionStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopUnlockRegionStream], this field is set to 0x5C.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopUnlockRegionStream].
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server object is stored.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]For More information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RegionOffset (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RegionOffset (8 bytes)]This value specifies the byte location in the stream where the region begins.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]RegionSize (8 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,RegionSize (8 bytes)]This value specifies the size of the region in bytes.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer]LockFlags (4 bytes): A flags structure.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LockFlags (4 bytes)]This structure contains flags specifying the behavior of the lock operation.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Request Buffer,LockFlags (4 bytes)]The possible values[0x001 and Any other value] for this structure are specified in [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.24.1.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopUnlockRegionStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopUnlockRegionStream], this field is set to 0x5C.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the InputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopUnlockRegionStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP]The RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP writes bytes to a stream and commits the stream.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.25.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopWriteAndCommitStream], this field is set to 0x90.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopWriteAndCommitStream].
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]More information about Server objects can be found in section 1.3.1.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]DataSize (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,DataSize (2 bytes)]This value specifies the size of the Data field.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer]Data (variable): An array of bytes.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,Data (variable)]The size of this field[Data (variable)], in bytes, is specified by the DataSize field.
[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Request Buffer,Data (variable)]This array contains the bytes to be written to the stream.

[In RopWriteAndCommitStream ROP Response Buffer]The response buffer for this ROP[RopWriteAndCommitStream] is the same as the response buffer for RopWriteStream, as specified in section 2.2.9.3.2, except the RopId field is set to 0x90.
[In RopCloneStream ROP]The RopCloneStream ROP creates a new Stream object based on the same data as another Stream object.
[In RopCloneStream ROP]For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPRPT] section 2.2.26.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCloneStream ROP request buffer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCloneStream], this field is set to 0x3B.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer]LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,LogonId (1 byte)]This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopCloneStream].
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,InputHandleIndex (1 byte)] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Request Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the output Server object will be stored.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopCloneStream ROP response buffer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer]RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer,RopId (1 byte)]For this operation[RopCloneStream], this field is set to 0x3B.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer]OutputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer,OutputHandleIndex (1 byte)]This index MUST be set to the value specified in the OutputHandleIndex field in the request.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer]ReturnValue (4 bytes): An unsigned integer.
[In RopCloneStream ROP Response Buffer,ReturnValue (4 bytes)]This value specifies the status of the ROP.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP] The RopModifyPermissions ROP modifies the permissions associated with a folder.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP] For more detailed about this operation, see [MS-OXCPERM] section 2.2.2.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer]The following descriptions define valid fields for the RopModifyPermissions ROP request buffer.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer] RopId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer, RopId (1 byte):] This value specifies the type of ROP.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer, RopId (1 byte):] For this operation [RopModifyPermissions], this field is set to 0x40.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer] LogonId (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer, LogonId (1 byte):] This value specifies the logon associated with this operation[RopModifyPermissions].
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer]InputHandleIndex (1 byte): An unsigned integer.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte):] This index specifies the location in the Server object handle table where the handle for the input Server Object is stored.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer, InputHandleIndex (1 byte):] For more information about Server objects, see section 1.3.1.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer] ModifyFlags (1 byte): A flags structure.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer,ModifyFlags (1 byte):] The possible values[0x01 and 0x02] are specified in [MS-OXCPERM] section 2.2.2.1.
[In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer,ModifyFlags (1 byte):] These flags control behavior of this operation[RopModifyPermissions].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCPERM_R1025, MS-OXCPERM_R1185, MS-OXCPERM_R47, MS-OXCPERM_R1187, MS-OXCPERM_R1188, MS-OXCPERM_R48, MS-OXCPERM_R39, MS-OXCPERM_R40, MS-OXCPERM_R41 MS-OXCPERM_R1189, MS-OXCPERM_R42, MS-OXCPERM_R1196.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In RopModifyPermissions ROP Request Buffer] ModifyCount (2 bytes): An unsigned integer.
